alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 15 at 12:39PM MST until February 16 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST /7 PM MST/ THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, WESTERN PERMIAN BASIN, AND UPPER TRANS PECOS FOR VERY HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO, WESTERN PERMIAN BASIN, AND UPPER TRANS PECOS FOR VERY HIGH TO EXTREME FIRE DANGER... * TIMING...For the warning, this morning through early this evening. For the watch, Wednesday afternoon through early Wednesday evening. * WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 5 percent. * RFTI...6 or critical.
info.instruction: A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity and warm temperatures will increase potential for fire growth. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
